intro: Talinum thompsonii, commonly known as Thompson's malanga, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots are often harvested for culinary use, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its genus. Talinum thompsonii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
